ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Best practices for writing Python well, tools and techniques available, how to debug code, how to develop a software package, writing code to address routine and critical needs in astronomy. Everything we learn here is directly applicable to tasks you will do in the real world, regardless of whether you stay in astronomy.
Application based coding (not entirely astro! Useful for astronomy kids looking to go into data science too)
I improved my coding skills immensely, gaining insight into not just computational Astronomy techniques but many facets of programming overall.
I learned a lot about programming, both in general and for astronomy. Perhaps the most valuable skills were those of code structure/organization which have really improved my outlook on coding!

This course helped to develop proficiency in Python and relevant packages used in scientific and data analysis. I was able to attain a mature understanding of programming techniques used in astronomy and technical problem-solving to tackle scientific goals.
I got a lot more advanced in my knowledge of coding in python and applying it in an astrophysical sense along with ways I can use these skills elsewhere.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is very front-heavy: the psets early on are hard and they kicked my butt and were time consuming, but I couldn't ever be upset about it because the psets are the lesson and you get a lot out of them and become a better coder in the process. Marla and Imad were amazing and super accessible and provided tons of support throughout  this is not your typical science class where the prof leaves you to flounder on your own and fails to explain things. The problems were tough, but I never left office hours without the help I needed to solve them. You get out what you put in, and if you come to lecture and do the work, the final project isn't as big and scary as it seems at the start. The psets also scale back significantly in length and difficulty once you start working on the final project, and Marla and Imad were incredibly responsive and adaptable to the needs and pacing of the course. They were also very amenable to discussing and re-explaining anything we were interested in learning about, instead of sticking to a strict schedule.

Strengths: the problem sets are genuinely helpful for becoming familiar with new coding techniques.
Weaknesses: none!
The course format (lesson, lab day, interview) was great for my learning and the professors do a great job keeping everyone engaged and building class community!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES! It's hard, but Marla curated her students to make sure that the class has a great cohort of supportive people who want to help each other, and Imad was an amazing teacher. Both were super accessible, and everyone who wants to do anything in physics/astronomy NEEDS to take this course. Also super useful for those not going into research, because Python skills are universally in demand.
Hands down one of the best classes I have taken at Yale. Would definitely recommend.
YES you will learn valuable tools for any STEM or data science career
Absolutely. If you're an astronomy or physics major it's a must, but for anybody interested in a comprehensive dive into a variety of programming topics I would recommend it.

I would recommend this class, particularly if you are interested in programming and astronomy and want to develop your skills! The assignments are unique and the final project was a ton of fun and very gratifying!

I would definitely recommend this class! The skills we learned are invaluable for the field and the instructors were very accommodating. I would just preface my recommendation by saying that I would spend hours upon hours working on psets, so this is a class to prioritize more than others.
